heisig_chinese_memo: My personification for this primative is Legolas from the Lord of the Rings: a master at the bow. I suppose robin hood etc would work too.
heisig_story: This character pictures the bent wooden bow. Later we will learn how to make the bowstring that goes with it (Frame 1490). If you stretch this character out and see the indentation on the left as its handle, the pictography should be clearer.
koohiiStory1: My personification for this primative is Legolas from the Lord of the Rings: a master at the bow. I suppose robin hood etc would work too.
koohiiStory2: I have a BOW made from a SNAKE that I BOUND UP. He sure wasn¬¥t happy!
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The bow radical and the bow kanji are exactly the same!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Make sure you know those radicals!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You have a bow in one hand and in the other... a cucumber („Åç„ÇÖ„ÅÜ). You're going to shoot this cucumber with this bow into the salad you're making. Many people don't know this, but this makes your cucumbers taste better.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine fitting a cucumber into the string of your bow. Imagine the smell of it as you draw the string back. Mm, take a quick bite, then let it loose.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: My personification for this primative is Legolas from the Lord of the Rings: a master at the bow. I suppose robin hood etc would work too.
origin_of_ch_char_book: Warrior shooting an arrow (AD 618-907) (Âºï, yin, draw) shows an action of drawing an arrow from the bow. There are the bow (Âºì) and bowstring . Since it was not easy to make a firm bowstring back then, the string was not attached to the bow all the time. The bow with the string unfastened looks like this: Âºì (gong, bow).
humanum_full_description_en:
hieroglyphic characters, oracle bone inscriptions and early inscriptions on the bow with strings on them. Later, the string was omitted, and it was the original version of the small seal character of "Suo Wen". The original meaning of " bow " is an archery tool. The word " bow " in the oracle bone inscription resembles a bow of string, with a horizontal bow on it (Gao Hongjin). When the character " bow " is used as a radical in oracle bone inscriptions, every time its string is omitted, it resembles the shape of a bow (a bow with the string removed), such as " yin " and " hong ". The inscriptions of the Western Zhou Dynasty and the Xiaozhuan of "Shuowen" have always adopted this configuration without string strings. In the bamboo slips of the Warring States Period, the lower part of the " bow " often has a little or a painting pen. You can see the glyphs of the bamboo slips of Shanghai Museum and the bamboo slips of Baoshan.

Oracle and end of weekly inscriptions, the " bow " word used primarily as family or person's name, such as "collection" 21659: "Bow return," put " bow " as a name. In the inscriptions of the Western Zhou Dynasty, " bow " also has its original meaning. Just like Âç£: "Wang Wang Yi (given) the same golden cart, bow, and arrow" refers to the bronze car, bow and arrow bestowed by the king. In addition, the word "tong bow" is often seen in the bronze inscriptions, such as Yihoukui: "Tong bow one, Tong Shi hundred." This section of the text and "Book. The Life of Wen Hou," Zuo Zhuan. "The Twenty-eight Years of Xi Gong" is the same and can be verified by each other. "Tong Gong" refers to the red lacquered bow, which was used by the emperor in ancient times to bestow meritorious princes or ministers so that they can concentrate on conquests.

"Shuowen": "The bow is near and far away. Pictogram. The ancients wield the bow. "Zhou Li. Six Bows": "The king bow and the arc bow are very good for shooting armor; the clamp bow and the Yu bow are used to shoot dry birds Beasts; Tang bows and big bows to teach how to shoot." All bows belong to the bow."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The ancient word " bow " resembles a stringed bow and is a tool for archery.

hieroglyphic characters, oracle bone inscriptions and early inscriptions on the bow with strings on them. Later, the string was omitted, and it was the original version of the small seal character of "Suo Wen". The original meaning of " bow" is an archery tool. The word " bow" in the oracle bone inscription resembles a bow of string, with a horizontal bow on it (Gao Hongjin). When the character " bow" is used as a radical in oracle bone inscriptions, every time its string is omitted, it resembles the shape of a bow (a bow with the string removed), such as " yin" and " hong". The inscriptions of the Western Zhou Dynasty and the Xiaozhuan of "Shuowen" have always adopted this configuration without string strings. In the bamboo slips of the Warring States Period, the lower part of the " bow" often has a little or a painting pen. You can see the glyphs of the bamboo slips of Shanghai Museum and the bamboo slips of Baoshan. Oracle and end of weekly inscriptions, the " bow" word used primarily as family or person's name, such as "collection" 21659: "Bow return," put " bow" as a name. In the inscriptions of the Western Zhou Dynasty, " bow" also has its original meaning. Just like Âç£: "Wang Wang Yi (given) the same golden cart, bow, and arrow" refers to the bronze car, bow and arrow bestowed by the king. In addition, the word "tong bow" is often seen in the bronze inscriptions, such as Yihoukui: "Tong bow one, Tong Shi hundred." This section of the text and "Book. The Life of Wen Hou," Zuo Zhuan. "The Twenty-eight Years of Xi Gong" is the same and can be verified by each other. "Tong Gong" refers to the red lacquered bow, which was used by the emperor in ancient times to bestow meritorious princes or ministers so that they can concentrate on conquests. bow
Basic explanation of words
bow
g≈çng
Apparatus for archery or projectile: bows and arrows. Crossbow. When the birds are gone, good bows are hidden.
A bow-like instrument or form: Huqin bow. Bow shoes.
The old instruments and calculation units used to measure acres of land.
Bend: arched body.
name.
bow
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªg≈çngÔºΩ
["Guangyun" Ju Rongqie, Pingdong, see you. ]
(1) Archery or bullet shooting equipment. A tough string is tied between the two ends of the elastic wooden strip that is approximately arc-shaped, and an arrow or projectile is placed, the string is pulled open, and the hand is suddenly let go, and the arrow or projectile is shot out by the elastic force of the string and the bow. The handle of the bow is called Âº£; the tip of the bow is called Âº∞; the string at both ends is called jun; the curve on both sides of the Âº£ is called Gongyuan, also known as Kuma.
(2) Bowing.
(3) Shaped like a bow; things shaped like a bow.
(4) The provincial name of the bow pattern. One of the basic types of fingerprints, consisting of many arched lines. The lines enter from one side and flow out from the other side. The middle part of the fingerprint is arched, without whirlpools and triangles.
(5) Bending.
(6) The extension is bending, which means saluting.
(7) The provincial name of Gongzhao.
(8) The provincial name of the old bow.
(9) Quantifiers. It was a unit of length at the same distance from the bow, corresponding to a step. Later it was also used as a unit of calculation for measuring acres. Its system varies from generation to generation: either eight feet is a bow; or six feet is a bow; the old ruler used five feet as a bow (1.6 meters), three hundred and sixty bows are one li, two hundred and forty The square bow is one mu.
(10) Quantifiers. Indian length name. The free translation of Sanskrit dhanus.
(11) Quantifiers. Also used in the sky, moon, etc.
(12) Link "brachial".
(13) Last name. There are bows in the Han Dynasty, see "Tongzhi¬∑Clan IV".

[Zhou Li¬∑Dongguan Kao Gong Ji] The bow man is a bow, and the six materials must be selected according to the time. The six materials are gathered together, and the clever ones are harmonious. Those who do it think it‚Äôs far away, those who think it‚Äôs ill, those who think it‚Äôs deep, those who use rubber think it‚Äôs harmony, those who use silk think it‚Äôs solid, and those who paint it think they suffer from frost and dew.„ÄÄThe car is covered again. „ÄêZhou Li¬∑Dongguan Kao Gong Ji¬∑Lun Ren„ÄëFour bows and chisels. Three hundred and sixty steps are one mile, and three hundred bows. [Story of the Western Regions] The little drummer smells five hundred bows. bow
Source glyph
bow
Name meaning
: The original meaning refers to the equipment used to shoot arrows or bullets. There is also the meaning of bending, which is extended to bending, which means saluting.

Radicals: Âºì  (bow)
Meaning Mnemonic
The bow radical and the bow kanji are exactly the same!
Make sure you know those radicals!
Reading Mnemonic
You have a bow in one hand and in the other... a cucumber („Åç„ÇÖ„ÅÜ). You're going to shoot this cucumber with this bow into the salad you're making. Many people don't know this, but this makes your cucumbers taste better.
